s1: Defensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of anomaly / intrusion detection and identification mechanisms.
s2: Have a basis of the knowledge and skills in research projects that can be built upon for more substantial projects.

s1: Students will also learn and exercise handling of an existing intrusion which includes forensic operations as well as securing the remaining systems.
s2: Throughout the course there will be meetings where students discuss all aspects of their projects, as well as a set of lectures about different aspects of being a successful researcher.

s1: This is a complete course in cyber defense which enables students on successful completion to operate systems under real-world exposure.
s2: This course provides students with hands-on experience of being a researcher in the computing discipline.

s1: Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the fundamental principles underlying the defence of systems and networks.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: Define and identify defensive cyber security architectures and their purpose.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: Operate defensive network architectures and systems in a practical context.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: Extrapolate current threats and identify potential, future threats.
s2: Have a basis of the knowledge and skills in research projects that can be built upon for more substantial projects.

s1: Communicate a cyber security situation and response to a heterogenous team of professionals.
s2: Have a basis of the knowledge and skills in research projects that can be built upon for more substantial projects.
